slug: /213
title: "This Week In React #213: React 19, Next.js, React Compiler, React Router, Restyle, Lingui, State of RN, Uniffi, Shared Objects, Fast IO, Sheet Transitions, Radon, TC39, OpenAuth, TypeScript, Dioxus..."
authors: [matthieugicquel, cyrilbo]
date: 12-11-2024
---
Cyril and Matthieu from Theodo Apps (formerly BAM) here ğŸ‘‹, standing in for Seb to bring you the latest news from React and React Native!

segments.source_content: React 19 is officially stable. The number of articles and releases we mention below that are linked to its new features show how big a release this is ğŸ™‚
The State of React Native 2024 survey is live. Donâ€™t miss your chance to shape the future of React Native!
Thereâ€™s also exciting progress in using Rust for frontend apps with tools like Uniffi for React Native and Dioxus, paving the way for more powerful, cross-platform experiences.

segments.source_content: With WorkOS you can start selling to enterprises with just a few lines of code.
ğŸ”Â WorkOS AuthKit supports a complete user management solution along with **SSO, SCIM, RBAC, & FGA**.

segments.source_content: ğŸ—ï¸Â The APIs are **flexible, easy-to-use, and modular**. Pick and choose what you need and integrate in minutes.
ğŸ¨ Design and user experience are everything. From the quality of our documentation to how your users onboard, we **remove all the unnecessary complexity for developers**.
âœ¨Â AuthKit is **free up to 1 million MAUs** and includesÂ bot protection, MFA, RBAC, & more.
ğŸ¤ WorkOS is trusted by hundreds of leading startups like **Perplexity**, **Vercel**, & **Webflow**.

React 19 RCs' has been one of the main characters of this newsletter for the past year, so thereâ€™s not much more to say apart that it's officially stable, apart 2 new features: the pre-warming feature that delayed the release, and new React-DOM static APIs. Here's a good reminder of other features we already covered;

segments.source_content:
- Actions / Server Actions / `useActionState()`
- `<form>` \+ progressive enhancement compatible hooks
- `<Context>` instead of `<Context.Provider>`
- The `use()` hook
- Custom Elements
- Ref as standard props and ref callbacks cleanup functions
- Meta tags handling
- Resource preloading
- Better errors and hydration diff reporting

- ğŸ’¸ [React Bricks â€“ the Visual CMS for React got more accessible with lower entry price and flexible pay-as-you-go options. Start for free!](https://www.reactbricks.com/?utm_source=twir&utm_campaign=ql24)
- ğŸ“– [A new React Router tutorial](https://reactrouter.com/tutorials/address-book): It goes over most of the features youâ€™ll need in \~30 minutes
- ğŸ“œ [How React Compiler Performs on Real Code](https://www.developerway.com/posts/how-react-compiler-performs-on-real-code): Enabling the compiler on a real app led to same performance on initial load, and improved performance on interactions. But the compiler is not always able to fully optimize your existing code.
- ğŸ“œ [Ref Callbacks, React 19 and the Compiler](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/ref-callbacks-react-19-and-the-compiler): TkDodo looks into ref callbacks, which now have cleanup functions. When should they replace `useEffect` ?
- ğŸ“œ [Building Scalable Micro-Frontends with Next.js Multi Zones](https://techhub.iodigital.com/articles/building-scalable-micro-frontends-with-next-js-multi-zones): Being able to deploy independently is a major advantage for big teams, and it turns out itâ€™s not that complicated with Next.js
- ğŸ“œ [Root Element API in waku](https://waku.gg/blog/root-element-api): Customize `<html>`, `<body>` and `<head>` in a `\_root.tsx` file
- ğŸ“œ [Multi-framework docs with Astro Starlight](https://blog.arcjet.com/multi-framework-docs-with-astro-starlight/)
- ğŸ“œ [SSR is not expensive](https://t3.gg/blog/post/ssr-is-not-expensive)
- ğŸ“œ [Reflections on managing state](https://www.frontendundefined.com/posts/monthly/react-state-management-reflections/)
- ğŸ“¦ [Next.js 15.1](https://nextjs.org/blog/next-15-1): React 19 stable, improved error debugging, `after` (to run code after the response is sent, eg for analytics) is stable, and new experimental `forbidden` and `unauthorized` APIs that work like `notFound`
- ğŸ“¦ [Restyle 3.0](https://www.restyle.dev/): A very lightweight CSS-in-JS lib for React which uses the new React 19 metadata APIs
- ğŸ“¦ [Lingui 5.0](https://lingui.dev/blog/2024/11/28/announcing-lingui-5.0): Support for RSC and a new `useLingui` macro among other improvements.
- ğŸ“¦ [react-render-stream-testing-library 2.0](https://github.com/testing-library/react-render-stream-testing-library/releases/tag/v2.0.0): No major new features, some breaking changes were necessary to be compatible with React 19

segments.source_content: Stream's Video React SDK empowers developers to integrate video calls, conferencing, and livestreaming with ease.
âœ”ï¸ **By Developers for Developers:** Fully customizable UI components and hooks, comprehensive documentation, and quickstart templates.
âœ”ï¸ **Blazing-Fast Performance:** Sub-200ms latency and WebRTC-powered scalability.
âœ”ï¸ **Out-of-the-Box Features:** Group calls, screen sharing, and adaptive bitrate, codecs, etc.
Build Fast. Scale Effortlessly. [Get Started With Stream](https://getstream.io/try-for-free/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=&utm_campaign=thisweekinreact).

The State of React Native 2024 survey is live\! ğŸ“Š This is your chance to influence the future of React Native by sharing insights on trends, tools, and challenges. Your feedback helps guide the Expo and Meta teams in shaping improvements each year, benefiting the entire community.

- ğŸ“œ [Introducing Uniffi for React Native: Rust-Powered Turbo Modules](https://hacks.mozilla.org/2024/12/introducing-uniffi-for-react-native-rust-powered-turbo-modules/): Uniffi for React Native integrates Rust with Turbo Modules, unlocking the entire Rust crates ecosystem for React Native apps.
